t: Luke 4
Jesus Is Tested in the Wilderness
Jesus,*p full of the Holy Spirit, left the Jordan and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
where for forty days he was tempted by the devil. He ate nothing during those days, and at the end of them he was hungry.
The*p devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread.”
Jesus*p answered, “It*r is*r written:*r ‘Man*r shall*r not*r live*r on*r bread*r alone.’”*r
The*p devil led him up to a high place and showed him in an instant all the kingdoms of the world.
And he said to him, “I will give you all their authority and splendor; it has been given to me, and I can give it to anyone I want to.
If you worship me, it will all be yours.”
Jesus*p answered, “It*r is*r written:*r ‘Worship*r the*r Lord*r your*r God*r and*r serve*r him*r only.’”*r
The*p devil led him to Jerusalem and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down from here.
For it is written: “ ‘He*pn will command his angels concerning you to*ld guard you carefully;
they*ln will lift you up in their hands, so*ld that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’”
Jesus*p answered, “It*r is*r said:*r ‘Do*r not*r put*r the*r Lord*r your*r God*r to*r the*r test.’”*r
When*p the devil had finished all this tempting, he left him until an opportune time.
Jesus Rejected at Nazareth
Jesus*p returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread through the whole countryside.
He was teaching in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.
He*p went to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, and on the Sabbath day he went into the synagogue, as was his custom. He stood up to read,
and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. Unrolling it, he found the place where it is written:

“The*rpn Spirit*r of*r the*r Lord*r is*r on*r me,*r because*rld he*r has*r anointed*r me*r to*rld proclaim*r good*r news*r to*r the*r poor.*r He*rln has*r sent*r me*r to*r proclaim*r freedom*r for*r the*r prisoners*r and*rld recovery*r of*r sight*r for*r the*r blind,*r to*rln set*r the*r oppressed*r free,*r
to*rld proclaim*r the*r year*r of*r the*r Lord’s*r favor.”*r
Then*p he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant and sat down. The eyes of everyone in the synagogue were fastened on him.
He began by saying to them, “Today*r this*r scripture*r is*r fulfilled*r in*r your*r hearing.”*r
All*p spoke well of him and were amazed at the gracious words that came from his lips. “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?” they asked.

Jesus*p said to them, “Surely*r you*r will*r quote*r this*r proverb*r to*r me:*r ‘Physician,*r heal*r yourself!’*r And*r you*r will*r tell*r me,*r ‘Do*r here*r in*r your*r hometown*r what*r we*r have*r heard*r that*r you*r did*r in*r Capernaum.’ ”*r
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,”*r he continued, “no*r prophet*r is*r accepted*r in*r his*r hometown.*r

I*r assure*r you*r that*r there*r were*r many*r widows*r in*r Israel*r in*r Elijah’s*r time,*r when*r the*r sky*r was*r shut*r for*r three*r and*r a*r half*r years*r and*r there*r was*r a*r severe*r famine*r throughout*r the*r land.*r
Yet*r Elijah*r was*r not*r sent*r to*r any*r of*r them,*r but*r to*r a*r widow*r in*r Zarephath*r in*r the*r region*r of*r Sidon.*r
And*r there*r were*r many*r in*r Israel*r with*r leprosy*r in*r the*r time*r of*r Elisha*r the*r prophet,*r yet*r not*r one*r of*r them*r was*r cleansed—only*r Naaman*r the*r Syrian.”*r
All*p the people in the synagogue were furious when they heard this.
They got up, drove him out of the town, and took him to the brow of the hill on which the town was built, in order to throw him off the cliff.
But he walked right through the crowd and went on his way.
Jesus Drives Out an Impure Spirit
Then*p he went down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, and on the Sabbath he taught the people.
They were amazed at his teaching, because his words had authority.
In*p the synagogue there was a man possessed by a demon, an impure spirit. He cried out at the top of his voice,
“Go away! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”
“Be*rp quiet!”*r Jesus said sternly. “Come*r out*r of*r him!”*r Then the demon threw the man down before them all and came out without injuring him.
All*p the people were amazed and said to each other, “What words these are! With authority and power he gives orders to impure spirits and they come out!”
And the news about him spread throughout the surrounding area.
Jesus Heals Many
Jesus*p left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked Jesus to help her.
So he bent over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up at once and began to wait on them.
At*p sunset, the people brought to Jesus all who had various kinds of sickness, and laying his hands on each one, he healed them.
Moreover, demons came out of many people, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew he was the Messiah.
At*p daybreak, Jesus went out to a solitary place. The people were looking for him and when they came to where he was, they tried to keep him from leaving them.
But he said, “I*r must*r proclaim*r the*r good*r news*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r to*r the*r other*r towns*r also,*r because*r that*r is*r why*r I*r was*r sent.”*r
And he kept on preaching in the synagogues of Judea.
